Method Detail

generateKey

public static javax.crypto.SecretKey generateKey(int keysize)
                                          throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                                 java.security.NoSuchProviderException
Generates a key. Sets the intern attribute key to the generated key. With this generated key, you can encrypt and decrypt Byte-Arrays.

Parameters:
keysize - Size of the key in bits (e.g. 128, 256)
Returns:
generated secret key
Throws:
java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
java.security.NoSuchProviderException
See Also:
encrypt(byte[], Key), decrypt(byte[], Key)

                      throws java.lang.Exception
Encrypt the data with a given Key.

Parameters:
input - The data to encrypt as a Byte-Array
encryptionKey - The key for the encryption
Returns:
Return the encrypted Byte-Array
Throws:
java.lang.Exception
See Also:
Key

decrypt

public static byte[] decrypt(byte[] input,
                             java.security.Key decryptionKey)
                      throws java.lang.Exception
Decrypt the data with a given Key.

Parameters:
input - The encrypted data as a Byte-Array
decryptionKey - The key for the decryption
Returns:

Throws:
java.lang.Exception
